title: ripgrep is slow when detecting whitespace literals, e.g., `'[ \t]$'`

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: An enhancement to the functionality of the software.

labels.name: rollup
labels.description: A PR that has been merged with many others in a rollup.

body:
#### What version of ripgrep are you using?

ripgrep 0.10.0
-SIMD -AVX (compiled)
+SIMD -AVX (runtime)

#### How did you install ripgrep?

cargo install ripgrep

#### What operating system are you using ripgrep on?

My system is Mageia Linux v7 x86-64 on a Core i3 Sandy Bridge machine.

rg is much slower than ag when searching for the `'[ \t]$'` regex on a
sample repo. With this benchmark case:


```bash
#! /bin/bash
#
# ag-rg-bench.bash
# Copyright (C) 2018 Shlomi Fish <shlomif@cpan.org>
#
# Distributed under terms of the MIT license.
#

set -e -x
d=freecell-pro-0fc-deals

if ! test -d "$d"
then
    git clone https://github.com/shlomif/freecell-pro-0fc-deals
fi

rg --version
ag --version
locale
(
    cd "$d"
    set +e
    time ag '[ \t]$'
    time rg '[ \t]$'
    time ag '[ \t]$'
    time rg '[ \t]$'
    time rg '[ \t]$'
)
```

I am getting the following:

